burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming

Class AgentQSourceMap.MAQLControlledQSourceMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.stochasticgames.madynamicprogramming.AgentQSourceMap.MAQLControlledQSourceMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AgentQSourceMap
    Enclosing interface:
    AgentQSourceMap

    public static class AgentQSourceMap.MAQLControlledQSourceMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentQSourceMap
    An implementation of the AgentQSourceMap in which different agent objects each maintain their own personal Q-source. This is useful if all agents are implementing the same multi-agent learning algorithm so that each agent doesn't have to replicate the learned Q-values for all other agents; instead only one copy will be kept for each agent. For example, this can be useful when all agents implement CoCo-Q learning.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Constructor Detail

      • AgentQSourceMap.MAQLControlledQSourceMap

        public AgentQSourceMap.MAQLControlledQSourceMap(java.util.List<Agent> agents)
        Initializes with the list of agents that each keep their own Q-source. Agent instances are expected to be of type MultiAgentQLearning. This constructor accepts a list of regular agents, however, to make construction easier. An exception will be thrown if all of all of the agents are not of the right type.
        Parameters:
        agents - a list of Agent objects, each which is an instance MultiAgentQLearning.

        Description copied from interface: AgentQSourceMap
        Returns a QSource which can be used to query the Q-values of a given agent.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        agentName - the name of the agent for which Q-values will be queried.
